title: Butternut Squash Biryani
keywords: Biryani, Butternut squash, Baked, Indian, Spiced rice, Vegetarian

method.step: Before you begin
This recipe takes around 5 minutes to prep, so get your casserole dick and all your ingredients ready, then wash your fruit and vegetables
(Make sure your dish is oven proof and safe to use on the hob, donâ€™t have one? Start cooking in a large wide based pan then transfer to a oven proof dish and cover tightly with foil)
Preheat the oven to 220C / 200C (fan) / gas 7
Boil a kettle
Heat a large wide based, how safe oven proof casserole dish with a matching lid with a drizzle of olive oil over a heigh heat
Once hot add your butternut squash cubes to the dish
Chop you tomato(es) into wedges
Crush your garlic cloves open by squashing them with the side of a knife and remove the skins
Add the tomato wedges and crush garlic to the dish
Crush your cardamon pods open by squashing them with the side of a knife
Slice your ginger in half (no need to peel)
Chop you creamed coconut roughly (if required)
Dissolve the chopped cream coconut and vegetable stock mix with your boiled water.  This is your coconut stock
Add the crushed cardamon pods and halves ginger to the dish with your ground turmeric, curry powder and bay leaf(ves) and give everything a good mix up
Add your basmati rice with the coconut stock and bring to the boil over a heigh heat
Cover with a lid an put the dish in the oven for 15-20 minutes or until all the water has been absorbed, the squash is fork tender and the rice is cooked
Once the rice is cooked, remove the dish from the oven and set aside for 5 minutes to steam.  This is your baked butternut squash biryani
Slice your green chilli(es) finely
Chop your coriander roughly, including the stalks
To serve, fluff the baked butternut squash biryani with a fork, stir through the chopped coriander and season with a generous pinch of salt and pepper
Top with the sliced green chilli and crispy onions
(Watch out for ginger halves, cardamom pods and pay leaves and discard)
Enjoy
